articles.title: Small Caps Are Positioned to Benefit From Falling Rates
articles.summary: Small-cap equities are poised to benefit from falling interest rates and loosening financial conditions, despite the heterogeneous nature of past rate-cutting cycles. Historically, small caps have shown stronger returns following rate cuts, especially after the conclusion of these cycles. With the potential for a soft landing and current economic strength, future rate cuts could lead to above-average performance for small-cap investments.

articles.title: Transportadora de Gas del Sur S.A.’s $490 Million Global Bond Offering and Concurrent Tender Offer
articles.summary: Cleary Gottlieb represented initial purchasers and dealer managers in Transportadora de Gas del Sur S.A.'s (TGS) $490 million global bond offering and concurrent tender offer. The transaction involved an offering of 8.5% senior notes due 2031 and a tender offer for outstanding 6.75% senior notes due 2025. TGS is the largest natural gas transporter in Argentina and operates the most extensive pipeline system in Latin America.

articles.title: BankUnited Names Amanda Pires to Senior Vice President Role in Commercial Banking
articles.summary: BankUnited Inc. (NYSE: BKU) has appointed Amanda Pires as senior vice president and producing team leader for its Broward/Palm Beach commercial banking team. Pires brings over 23 years of banking experience, including 18 years in South Florida's commercial sector, with previous roles at Wells Fargo, JPMorgan Chase, and Bank of America. Her extensive background is expected to strengthen BankUnited's commercial banking services in the region.

articles.title: Goldman Sachs hires Habib Saikaly to run Middle East-focused funds
articles.summary: Goldman Sachs has hired Habib Saikaly, a veteran from JPMorgan, to lead its new Middle East-focused fund. This strategic move aims to capitalize on the region's growth and dynamism, aligning with Goldman's expansion efforts and increasing pressure from sovereign wealth funds to invest within the region. Saikaly will oversee the fund's development from Riyadh, contributing to Goldman's enhanced regional presence, especially in Saudi Arabia.

articles.title: Capital One-Discover deal critics, supporters sound off
articles.summary: A public meeting was held by bank regulatory agencies to discuss Capital One's proposed $35.3 billion acquisition of Discover, drawing both strong criticism and robust support. While Capital One highlighted a new five-year, $265 billion community benefits plan, critics, including the National Community Reinvestment Coalition and Rep. Maxine Waters, raised concerns about industry consolidation and potential negative impacts on consumers and financial stability. The public comment period on the merger is scheduled to end on July 24.

articles.title: Carlyle and KKR buy $10.1bn student loan portfolio
articles.summary: Carlyle and KKR have partnered to acquire a $10.1 billion portfolio of prime student loans from Discover Financial Services. Monogram LLC, a Carlyle portfolio company, will manage the portfolio, with the transaction expected to close by year-end. This deal highlights the growing role of private markets in providing flexible financial solutions as traditional lenders' priorities shift.

articles.title: State Street looks to create its own stablecoin: Bloomberg
articles.summary: State Street Corp. is reportedly exploring the creation of its own stablecoin and ways to settle payments on the blockchain, according to Bloomberg. The global financial services firm is also considering a deposit token, which would represent customer deposits on a blockchain. This move follows State Street's previous ventures into crypto, including establishing a digital assets unit in 2021 and partnering with Galaxy Asset Management to launch crypto-exposure ETFs.

articles.title: News | Problem Office Loans Drag On Results of More Major Banks, Though Signs of Optimism Appear
articles.summary: Major banks like Bank of America and PNC Financial Services Group continue to report significant charge-offs related to delinquent commercial real estate loans, particularly those tied to office properties, during the second quarter. While this extends a trend of increasing loan losses, Bank of America noted emerging positive signs, anticipating lower net charge-offs in the latter half of 2024. PNC, however, expects elevated charge-offs to persist through the year, highlighting ongoing challenges in the office market.

articles.title: Morgan Stanley sees 41% profit jump, but wealth management teeters
articles.summary: Morgan Stanley reported a 41% increase in quarterly profit, driven primarily by a 51% surge in investment banking fees. However, the bank's wealth management unit showed slower growth and lower net new assets than expected, leading to some concern despite the overall strong performance. CFO Sharon Yeshaya emphasized the bank's balanced business model and strong return on tangible common equity.

articles.title: Latham Advises Banks on US$8 Billion Financing for Atlas’ Public Tender Offer for Millicom
articles.summary: Latham & Watkins is advising a group of banks including BNP Paribas, Crédit Agricole Corporate and Investment Bank, JPMorgan, Natixis, and Société Générale on an US$8 billion financing for Atlas Luxco S.à r.l.'s public tender offer for Millicom International Cellular S.A. The financing will initially be debt via an interim facilities agreement, with plans to replace or refinance with long-term financing comprising various facilities including a US$2.6 billion term loan and a US$600 million revolving credit facility. The core Latham team is led by finance partners Dan Maze, Scott Colwell, and Xavier Farde.

articles.title: Cleveland-Cliffs to Buy Canada’s Stelco for $2.8 Billion
articles.summary: Cleveland-Cliffs Inc. has agreed to acquire Canadian steelmaker Stelco Holdings Inc. for approximately C$3.85 billion ($2.8 billion) in cash and shares, marking its first major acquisition after an unsuccessful bid for U.S. Steel last year. This deal, which represents an 87% premium over Stelco's July 12 closing price, will expand Cleveland-Cliffs' steelmaking footprint and double its exposure to the flat-rolled spot market. The acquisition is expected to close in the fourth quarter of 2024, subject to shareholder and regulatory approvals, with Cleveland-Cliffs pledging to maintain Stelco's Canadian presence and invest in its operations.

articles.title: Goldman Sachs posts earnings beat as traders outpace estimates
articles.summary: Goldman Sachs' second-quarter earnings significantly exceeded expectations, driven by strong performances in its fixed-income and equity trading units and a recovering capital markets business. Despite this, the firm's merger advisory fees fell short of analyst estimates and trailed behind JPMorgan Chase & Co., a rare occurrence for Goldman. The company continues to shift its strategy towards expanding investment banking and wealth management, moving away from its previous consumer banking expansion.

articles.title: Eastman Announces Cash Tender Offer to Purchase its 3.800% Notes due 2025
articles.summary: Eastman Chemical Company has announced a cash tender offer to purchase up to $250 million of its outstanding 3.800% Notes due 2025. The Tender Offer is set to expire on August 26, 2024, with an Early Tender Deadline of August 9, 2024, and includes an early tender premium for notes submitted by this deadline. The offer is conditional upon the successful completion of a new debt securities offering by the company.

articles.title: Riskified To Report Second Quarter 2024 Financial Results on Wednesday, August 14
articles.summary: Riskified Ltd. (NYSE: RSKD) announced it will report its second quarter 2024 financial results on Wednesday, August 14, 2024, before the market opens. Following the release, management will host a conference call and webcast at 8:30 a.m. ET to discuss the company's business and financial performance. Details for registration and webcast access are provided for investors and interested parties.

articles.title: FTC probes 8 companies for surveillance pricing practices
articles.summary: The FTC has launched a study into "surveillance pricing" practices, ordering eight companies, including Mastercard and JPMorgan Chase, to provide information on how they use consumer data to set prices. The agency is investigating how targeted pricing products, which use personal data like location and past purchases, affect prices for individual consumers. While no wrongdoing is alleged, FTC Chair Lina Khan expressed concerns about potential privacy risks and exploitation of personal information to charge higher prices.

articles.title: Morgan Stanley and Raymond James Financial top M&A financial advisers in financial services sector in H1 2024
articles.summary: Morgan Stanley and Raymond James Financial led as M&A financial advisers in the financial services sector during the first half of 2024. Morgan Stanley topped by deal value, advising on $53.2 billion, while Raymond James Financial led by volume with 16 deals. Both firms showed significant year-on-year improvements in their respective metrics.

articles.title: Ethereum ETFs May See ‘Lower-Than-Anticipated Demand’: Report
articles.summary: Algorithmic trading firm Wintermute predicts that Ethereum ETFs will likely see lower-than-anticipated demand, closer to $3.2 to $4 billion, compared to the $4.8-$6.4 billion range estimated by most analysts. This conservative outlook is attributed to the absence of a staking mechanism in the ETFs and a lack of a shared narrative to attract investors. Despite lower demand, Wintermute forecasts a potential 18% to 24% price increase for ETH, which is still below some analysts' predictions of a 50% surge to $5,000.

articles.title: The US’s best super-regional investment bank: Truist Securities
articles.summary: Truist Securities has been named the US's best super-regional investment bank by Euromoney, recognizing its top performance in equity and debt capital markets, syndicated loans, and M&A advisory in 2023. This award highlights the firm's consistency and progress since the merger of SunTrust and BB&T in late 2019. Tom Hackett, CEO of Truist Securities, credits the company's strong funding and talent base for its client-valued consistency.

articles.title: Warren Buffett's Recent Reduction in Bank of America Holdings
articles.summary: Warren Buffett's firm, Berkshire Hathaway, reduced its stake in Bank of America by selling over 33 million shares for $43.56 each. Despite this reduction, Bank of America remains a significant holding in Buffett's portfolio, representing 12.85% of his total investments. This strategic adjustment reflects Buffett's approach to portfolio balance and risk management, even as other market gurus also maintain holdings in BAC.

articles.title: Lazard AM makes the case for emerging markets
articles.summary: Lazard Asset Management's third-quarter outlook makes a strong case for investing in emerging market equities and debt, citing attractive valuations, monetary policy easing, improved earnings growth, and diversification benefits. The firm highlights that emerging market equities are significantly undervalued compared to developed markets and anticipates strong inflows as allocations revert to historical averages. In fixed income, emerging markets offer more attractive policy rates and credit spreads, positioning them favorably against developed markets.

articles.title: PNC Multifamily Capital Announces $176 Million Affordable Housing Fund
articles.summary: PNC Multifamily Capital announced the closing of its Low Income Housing Tax Credit (LIHTC) Fund 95, investing $176 million to develop and rehabilitate affordable rental housing across the U.S. This fund, which includes investments from PNC and seven other financial institutions, marks the first syndicated investment under the newly rebranded PNC Multifamily Capital group. The initiative will finance over 1,800 affordable housing units in 14 properties across 11 states, addressing the critical shortage in affordable housing supply.

articles.title: Light & Wonder Restructures Debt with $2.16 Billion Term Loan
articles.summary: Light & Wonder Inc. has restructured its debt by introducing a new $2.16 billion term loan due April 2029, replacing existing term loans. This strategic move, facilitated by JPMorgan Chase Bank, N.A., significantly reduces the applicable margin for interest rates, aiming to lower interest expenses and enhance financial flexibility. The company, which recently reported impressive revenue growth and gross profit margins, expects net income to grow this year, reflecting its ongoing efforts to optimize its capital structure.

articles.title: Societe Generale, Morgan Stanley and others buy Zomato shares worth Rs 635 crore via block deals
articles.summary: Societe Generale, Morgan Stanley, and other investors purchased Zomato shares totaling Rs 635 crore through block deals. Motilal Oswal Mutual Fund was a major seller in these transactions, offloading over 2.84 crore shares. This activity follows Zomato's recent increase in platform fees to Rs 6 per order and a 175% rally in its shares over the past year.

articles.title: Morgan Stanley Stock Jumps After Better-Than-Expected Q2 Earnings
articles.summary: Morgan Stanley (MS) reported stronger-than-expected Q2 earnings and revenue, with EPS of $1.82 and revenue of $15.02 billion, exceeding analysts' forecasts. The bank's stock rose nearly 3% following the announcement, despite more modest growth in its wealth management division. This performance follows a trend of other major banks also beating Q2 expectations.

articles.title: Alpha Cognition upgraded at Raymond James
articles.summary: Raymond James analyst Rahul Sarugaser has upgraded Alpha Cognition (CSE:ACOG) from "Market Perform 3" to "Outperform 2" and raised his price target from $1.00 to $2.00, citing upcoming catalysts. The upgrade is based on ALPHA-1062's relatively low-risk regulatory path with the U.S. FDA, given its promising bioequivalence study results and potential to be only the second drug approved for Alzheimer's Dementia this decade. If approved, ALPHA-1062, a symptom-modifying drug, could complement disease-modifying treatments like lecanemab, with a modeled maximum revenue opportunity of approximately US$500 million.

articles.title: 8 of the Best International Fund Managers
articles.summary: This article identifies eight top international fund managers for 2024, focusing on those with high-conviction portfolios in large-cap international stocks and a Morningstar Medalist Rating of Gold. It delves into their individual investment strategies, sector and country allocations, and unique approaches to stock-picking. The article highlights key qualities shared by these successful managers, such as in-depth fundamental research, preference for quality companies, and a patient, long-term investment horizon.

articles.title: Balance Longer Duration With EVSD While Capturing Income
articles.summary: Investors are optimistic about a September interest rate cut, leading many to extend bond durations. Morgan Stanley advises caution, advocating for a neutral bond position due to ongoing risks and a potentially slow rate cut cycle. The Eaton Vance Short Duration Income ETF (EVSD) is presented as a potential solution for investors seeking income and balancing longer-duration exposures, offering low interest rate risk and diversification benefits within a fixed-income portfolio.

articles.title: Citizens Recognized for ‘Top Innovation in Payments by a Bank’ at 2024 PayTech Awards
articles.summary: Citizens Cash Flow Essentials received the "Top Innovation in Payments by a Bank" award at the 2024 PayTech Awards for its online and mobile banking platform designed for small businesses. The platform, launched in 2023 and expanded in 2024, helps small business owners manage cash flow and make informed decisions. This recognition highlights Citizens' commitment to developing innovative digital tools and payment solutions.

articles.title: Five top European equity funds year-to-date
articles.summary: This article highlights five top-performing European equity funds available for distribution in Hong Kong and Singapore, which have excelled year-to-date while outperforming US equities. These funds, including both active and passive strategies, have capitalized on investments in companies like ASML, Novo Nordisk, and Rolls-Royce, demonstrating strong returns over one-year and five-year periods. The article notes that European equities have lagged behind US equities earlier in the year due to political uncertainty but may offer diversification for investors.
